name: Defender of the Order
text:
Morph {W}{W} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
When Defender of the Order is turned face up, creatures you control get +0/+2 until end of turn.

name: Defend the Hearth
text: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to players this turn.

editions.flavor: The defenders said not a word. Their shields, spears, and stances were warning enough.

name: Defense Grid
text: Each spell costs {3} more to cast except during its controller's turn.

editions.flavor:
"Woven together, strands of aether can form a mesh of surprising stability, though such a network tends to pull power from nearby devices."
—Consulate engineer's log
It lights up the sky, beckoning enemies only to repel them.

"We've managed to keep the goblins in their assigned areas, but there's little we can do about the smell."
—Whip Tongue, viashino technician

"A good deal of tyranny goes by the name of protection."
—Crystal Eastman,
"Equality or Protection"

name: Defense of the Heart
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if an opponent controls three or more creatures, sacrifice Defense of the Heart, search your library for up to two creature cards, and put those cards onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

name: Defensive Formation
text: Rather than the attacking player, you assign the combat damage of each creature attacking you. You can divide that creature's combat damage as you choose among any of the creatures blocking it.

editions.flavor:
"Your enemies will pound upon the door of your defenses, but only you shall have the key, and it is the key of life."
—Song of All, canto 873

name: Defensive Maneuvers
text: Creatures of the creature type of your choice get +0/+4 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: "Only on the battlefield can we repay all the Order has given us."

name: Defensive Stance
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -1/+1.

editions.flavor:
"It isn't for fighting. It's for when the fighting's gone bad."
—Kara Vrist, Mirran resistance

name: Defiant Bloodlord
text:
Flying
Whenever you gain life, target opponent loses that much life.

editions.flavor:
"Despite their bravado, mortals are fragile. If Zendikar is to endure, its lords must save it."
—Drana, Kalastria bloodchief
"Despite their bravado, mortals are fragile. If Zendikar is to endure, its lords must save it."—Drana, Kalastria bloodchief

"Despite their bravado, mortals are fragile. If Zendikar is to endure, its lords must save it."
—Drana, Kalastria bloodchief

name: Defiant Elf
text: Trample

editions.flavor: "I lost one home when Yavimaya was destroyed. I will not lose another."

name: Defiant Falcon
text:
Flying
{4}, {T}: Search your library for a Rebel permanent card with converted mana cost 3 or less and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

name: Defiant Greatmaw
text:
When Defiant Greatmaw enters the battlefield, put two -1/-1 counters on target creature you control.
Whenever you put one or more -1/-1 counters on Defiant Greatmaw, remove a -1/-1 counter from another target creature you control.

name: Defiant Ogre
text:
When Defiant Ogre enters the battlefield, choose one —
• Put a +1/+1 counter on Defiant Ogre.
• Destroy target artifact.

editions.flavor: "I have no clan, but I still have purpose."

name: Defiant Salvager
text: Sacrifice an artifact or creature: Put a +1/+1 counter on Defiant Salvager. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.

editions.flavor: "I didn't survive that crash just so I could fall to the likes of you."

name: Defiant Stand
text:
Cast Defiant Stand only during the declare attackers step and only if you've been attacked this step.
Target creature gets +1/+3 until end of turn. Untap that creature.

name: Defiant Strike
text:
Target creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
Draw a card.

editions.flavor:
"Stand where the whole battle can see you. Strike so they'll never forget."
—Anafenza, khan of the Abzan

name: Defiant Vanguard
text:
When Defiant Vanguard blocks, at end of combat, destroy it and all creatures it blocked this turn.
{5}, {T}: Search your library for a Rebel permanent card with converted mana cost 4 or less and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

name: Defiler of Souls
text:
Flying
At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player sacrifices a monocolored creature.

editions.flavor:
"Stray not into sin, lest you face the doorman of an insatiable tomb."
—Prayer of Asha

name: Defiling Tears
text: Until end of turn, target creature becomes black, gets +1/-1, and gains "{B}: Regenerate this creature."

editions.flavor: Serra's living warriors looked on in horror. "Where is our Lady now?" they cried.

name: Deflecting Palm
text: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage. If damage is prevented this way, Deflecting Palm deals that much damage to that source's controller.

name: Deflection
text: Change the target of target spell with a single target.

editions.flavor:
Up and down,
over and through,
back around—
the joke's on you.

Up and down,
over and through,
back around—
the joke's on you.

"You've thrown your net at the wrong fish."
—The Lord of Atlantis
The golden rule of revenge: Do unto others what they tried to do unto you.

Up and down,
over and through,
back around—
the joke's on you.

name: Deftblade Elite
text:
Provoke (Whenever this creature attacks, you may have target creature defending player controls untap and block it if able.)
{1}{W}: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by Deftblade Elite this turn.

name: Deft Dismissal
text: Deft Dismissal deals 3 damage divided as you choose among one, two, or three target attacking or blocking creatures.

editions.flavor:
"With spy thopters all around, how can the consuls be so blind to Tezzeret's manipulations?"
—Gideon Jura

name: Deft Duelist
text:
First strike
Shroud (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities.)

editions.flavor: Some Serul Cove rogues traffic in stolen sigils, which fetch a high price from those who would rather pay for honor than earn it.

name: Defy Death
text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield. If it's an Angel, put two +1/+1 counters on it.

editions.flavor: Gisela cornered the murderous demon among the graves of the dead villagers. "A fitting end," she murmured as she raised her sword.

name: Defy Gravity
text:
Target creature gains flying until end of turn.
Flashback {U} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

editions.flavor: Magical or not, it's still a cloud.

name: Dega Disciple
text:
{B}, {T}: Target creature gets -2/-0 until end of turn.
{R}, {T}: Target creature gets +2/+0 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: "There is no true equity of power. There is only more and less."

name: Dega Sanctuary
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if you control a black or red permanent, you gain 2 life. If you control a black permanent and a red permanent, you gain 4 life instead.

name: Degavolver
text:
Kicker {1}{B} and/or {R} (You may pay an additional {1}{B} and/or {R} as you cast this spell.)
If Degavolver was kicked with its {1}{B} kicker, it enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it and with "Pay 3 life: Regenerate Degavolver."
If Degavolver was kicked with its {R} kicker, it enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it and with first strike.

name: Deglamer
text: Choose target artifact or enchantment. Its owner shuffles it into his or her library.

editions.flavor: The more pleasant an illusion's garb, the more indecent its form laid bare.

name: Dehydration
text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.

editions.flavor:
"Cry to the sun and watch as even your tears forsake you."
—Acolyte of Marit Lage
The viashino used the spell to dry foods for crossing the Great Desert. The Suq'Ata later discovered its use in war.

"You say Saprazzo is a city built on water? I hope they have enough to wash the dust from my throat."
—Sisay

name: Deicide
text: Exile target enchantment. If the exiled card is a God card, search its controller's graveyard, hand, and library for any number of cards with the same name as that card and exile them, then that player shuffles his or her library.

editions.flavor:
"It is done."
—Elspeth

name: Deity of Scars
text:
Trample
Deity of Scars enters the battlefield with two -1/-1 counters on it.
{B/G}, Remove a -1/-1 counter from Deity of Scars: Regenerate Deity of Scars.

editions.flavor:
"His skin cuts swords."
—The Seer's Parables

name: Déjà Vu
text: Return target sorcery card from your graveyard to your hand.

editions.flavor: The past is a mirror of the future.
History is the study of repetition.

name: Delay
text: Counter target spell. If the spell is countered this way, exile it with three time counters on it instead of putting it into its owner's graveyard. If it doesn't have suspend, it gains suspend. (At the beginning of its owner's upkeep, remove a time counter from that card. When the last is removed, the player plays it without paying its mana cost. If it's a creature, it has haste.)

name: Delaying Shield
text:
If damage would be dealt to you, put that many delay counters on Delaying Shield instead.
At the beginning of your upkeep, remove all delay counters from Delaying Shield. For each delay counter removed this way, you lose 1 life unless you pay {1}{W}.

name: Delif's Cone
text: {T}, Sacrifice Delif's Cone: This turn, when target creature you control attacks and isn't blocked, you may gain life equal to its power. If you do, it assigns no combat damage this turn.

editions.flavor: "Where is it written that beasts must cause pain?" —Delif, Ponderings

name: Delif's Cube
text:
{2}, {T}: This turn, when target creature you control attacks and isn't blocked, it assigns no combat damage this turn and you put a cube counter on Delif's Cube.
{2}, Remove a cube counter from Delif's Cube: Regenerate target creature.

name: Delirium
text:
Cast Delirium only during an opponent's turn.
Tap target creature that player controls. That creature deals damage equal to its power to the player. Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by the creature this turn.

name: Delirium Skeins
text: Each player discards three cards.

editions.flavor: There came a rush, a sudden fire in the mind. Then the two saw only the sooty fog of madness, heard only the crackling of their last thoughts burning away.
There came a rush, a sudden fire in the mind. Then the two saw only the sooty fog of madness, heard only the crackling of their last thoughts burning away.

name: Deliver
text: Return target permanent to its owner's hand.

Trample
You may sacrifice three black creatures rather than pay Delraich's mana cost.

editions.flavor: It wears the souls of its victims like jewels on a chain.

name: Demystify

editions.flavor: The Singing City was silent, the pathway stones were still, and the winds of the Howling Spire ceased.

text:
Flying
Morph {2}{U}{U} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
When Dermoplasm is turned face up, you may put a creature card with a morph ability from your hand onto the battlefield face up. If you do, return Dermoplasm to its owner's hand.

name: Descendant of Kiyomaro
text: As long as you have more cards in hand than each opponent, Descendant of Kiyomaro gets +1/+2 and has "Whenever this creature deals combat damage, you gain 3 life."

editions.flavor: "The blood of Kiyomaro flows in my veins. He did not let Eiganjo fall and neither shall I."

name: Descendant of Masumaro
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, put a +1/+1 counter on Descendant of Masumaro for each card in your hand, then remove a +1/+1 counter from Descendant of Masumaro for each card in target opponent's hand.
